COMBAT TERRITORY.Definition: area where combat or fighting was taking place

APPROACH.Definition: the action of coming nearer to it

UNDERCARRIAGE.Definition: the landing gear or equipment of the aircraft

UNCONSCIOUS.Definition: not awake or aware of my environment

WHOOSH.Definition: a soft sound made by something moving fast through the air

BEARABLE.Definition: able to be endured or tolerated

BULLIED.Definition: frightened that other students would hurt him, harassed

PRANKSTER.Definition: someone who enjoyed playing practical jokes

MEMOIRS.Definition: pieces of writing about his personal experiences

RAKE.Definition: a garden tool with a long handle and pointed metal parts at the bottom

JUMPSTART.Definition: cause it to start, set in motion

ILLUSTRATORS.Definition: people whose job was to draw pictures

COPYRIGHT.Definition: the legal right to control the product

CRITICALLY ACCLAIMED.Definition: that have received good reviews from critics

TROLLS.Definition: ugly creatures found in traditional Scandinavian stories

FLOORBOARD.Definition: a long straight piece of wood making up part of the floor

POKER.Definition: a metal rod or stick with a handle, used for managing the fire of a fireplace

FLESH.Definition: the surface or skin of his body

SCREENPLAY.Definition: the text for the film, the script

VALVE.Definition: a device for controlling the passage of fluid through a pipe

NEUROSURGEON.Definition: a doctor specialising in surgery on the brain

STROKES.Definition: sudden losses of brain function caused by changes in the blood supply to a part of it

EVER THE PERSON.Definition: being one who always had this characteristic

DREW ON.Definition: used the experience of them as a resource

SHED.Definition: a small building used for storing things

OUTPUT.Definition: the amount of his works produced
